page.title: 19THE PRIMARY SCHOOL,HILTON
page.content: The Primary School,N.O.R.150 is based on two sites in the village. The original buildings - one classroom and a school house - were erected in 1856, and a second larger area was added in 1882. Log books for the school, dating back to 1880 provide a wealth of fascinating information about the school's history, from closure for the Tutbury Statutes (hiring fair),through the arrival of a contingent of evaccuees from Birmingham, right up to the present day.In 1970 a new Infants school was built at the other end of the village. It is a modern school with its own small swimming pool, for which funds were raised by the P.T.A. in the 1960's. At present plans are in effect for a new Junior department to be incorporated on the same site,and work is due to begin early in 1986.
